stories.text: I'm a long time hobbyist programmer (~20 years) with decent knowledge of a few languages (mainly Elixir, JS and PHP, but dabbled in others). I'm only thinking now of programming commercially — hoping for remote work — but have no portfolio or commercial track record. If you were in my situation, how would you go about proving your abilities to potential employers? Given my current situation, I could reasonably spend 3-6 months doing this.
stories.title: Ask HN: If you had 3-6 months to demonstrate your skills?
Unlearn.ai, a startup developing clinical trial ‘digital twins’, raises $50M

stories.text:
I came across a website that had HN users seeing if they could complete a registration process. People posted their times (13 minutes, 30 mins etc) in the comments. I can't seem to find it.

Does anyone remember what this was? Or have examples of websites that are similar?
stories.title: Ask HN: Website with worst UX or Registration experience
NASA's Perseverance rover captures video of solar eclipse on Mars
The fierce, messy fight over “healthy” sugar tech
The micronova: Astronomers discovered new type of stellar explosion
